718133f-a.title: Manhattan: Catherine Slip - South Street
718133f-a.text:
(1)
Catherine Slip, east side, north from South, to, but not including Cherry Streets, showing (foreground), No. 27, at the N.E. corner of South Street. It is only remaining tenement on the block. Also shown, overtowering the little house, is the west wall of the Hearst Publications Building.
September 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A detail of the same, showing a more prominent view of No. 27.
September 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
718133f-a.folder: Catherine Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

718133f-b.folder: Catherine Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

723320f-b.title: Manhattan: South Street - Catherine Slip
723320f-b.text:
(1)
South Street, west from Catherine Slip to Roosevelt Street; at which point it makes a sharp turn southward. Also shown, is a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge. Across same (left to right), are the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co., No. 60 Wall Street Tower and the Bank of Manhattan Co. Buildings.
June 22, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from another angle. Also shown, is Catherine Slip, at the N.W. corner of South Street (used as an automobile parking space), and Nos. 20 and 18. In the background are visible (left), the Woolworth Building and (right), the tower of the Municipal Building.
June 22, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A portion of the same, showing only Nos. 199, 198 and 197 South Street (left). Also shown, is a more extensive view on Catherine Slip to Water Street.
June 22, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

According to the New York Times of December 21, 1937, the clearance at the aforementioned corner will be improved with a one story structure, and used as a gasoline station.
723320f-b.folder: South Street & Catherine Slip, Manhattan, NY

718129f-a.title: Manhattan: Catherine Slip - South Street
718129f-a.text:
(1) Catherine Slip, east side, north from but not including South
Street, to but not including Water Street.
March 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view.
March 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, a more extensive view and showing Catherine Slip, north to and including Cherry Street, with the east side of Catherine Street (an extension), further northward. Large building shown is Knickerbocker Village.
October 14, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

723321f-b.title: Manhattan: South Street - Catherine Slip
723321f-b.text:
199 South Street, north side, west of Catherine Slip.
April 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

According to the New York Sun of September 12, 1938, this structure is to be demolished by the New York City Housing Authority.

718125f.title: Manhattan: Catherine Slip - South Street
718125f.text:
Catherine Slip, north from but not including South Street.
March 19, 1934
P. L. Sperr, photographer
718125f.folder: Catherine Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

718128f-a.title: Manhattan: Catherine Slip - South Street
718128f-a.text:
(1)
Catherine Slip, west side, north from South, to but not including Water Streets. Buildings on the left are Nos. 202 to 195 South Street and are on the north side, from Catherine Slip to Oliver Street; the corner building being No. 202. Adjoining this corner building is No. 24-22 Catherine Slip (the two 4-story buildings) occupied by the Catherine Mission. The building on the extreme right (No. 18 Catherine Slip) is the Italian Church and adjoins an empty lot directly at the S,W. corner of Water Street.
September 24, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view slightly northward, showing a one story garage at the S.W. corner of Water Street. Shown on the right are buildings on Water Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Catherine Slip.
May 1924.
Eugene L. Aymbruster Collection.
718128f-a.folder: Catherine Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

718128f-b.title: Manhattan: Catherine Slip - South Street
718128f-b.text:
(1)
Catherine Slip, west side, north from South, to but not including Water Streets. Adjoining this corner building is No. 24-22 Catherine Slip (the two 4-story buildings) occupied by the Catherine Mission. The building on the extreme right (No. 18 Catherine Slip) is the Italian Church and adjoins an empty lot directly at the S,W. corner of Water Street.

(2)

Eugene L. Aymbruster Collection.
718128f-b.folder: Catherine Slip & South Street, Manhattan, NY

723319f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Catherine Slip
723319f-a.text:
(1)
South Street, north side, east from and including Catherine Slip, showing (prominently) the New York American (Hearst Publications) Building, from Catherine to Market Slips. The little 4-story house shown clustered against the New York American Building, is No. 27 Catherine Slip. at the N.E. corner of South Street, and is the only remaining tenement on that entire block. A portion of the Manhattan Bridge is visible in the background.
June 22, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing an exclusive view of the Hearst Publication Building, and its "little neighbor".
May 3, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
723319f-a.folder: South Street & Catherine Slip, Manhattan, NY
